node.title: Tiny Indigenous township defies the odds on vaccination rate
node.alt: A group of people standing on either side of a sign, with an aircraft on an airstrip in the background.
node.description: A tiny Aboriginal community in South Australia's Flinders Ranges reaches a double vaccination rate of 80 per centÂ well ahead of the rest of the state.
node.content:
["A tiny Aboriginal community in South Australia's Flinders Ranges has proven its determination to protect itself from COVID-19 by reaching a double vaccination rate of 80 per cent well ahead of the rest of the state.", "More than 90 per cent of locals in Nepabunna, east of Leigh Creek, have received their first dose of the vaccine.", "\"We're ahead of the rest of South Australia in many ways, on a small scale, in our vaccination rate,\" Nepabunna Community Aboriginal Corporation chief executive Dave Petersen said.", "Mr Petersen said while community leaders had to deal with many of the same issues as other regions \u2014\u00a0vaccine hesitancy, logistical challenges caused by isolation and availability of vaccines \u2014\u00a0it was able to overcome them.", "The biggest factor in the high vaccine rate, he said, was an upgrade to the community's airstrip.", "It meant the community did not have to solely rely on the local Aboriginal medical service, which did not have immediate access to Pfizer vaccines.", "", "
Nepabunna is about 70 kilometres east of Leigh Creek.(ABC News)
", "\"Our airstrip was not rated and safe for aircraft to operate out of, so the government has provided funds to bring that airfield up to safe standard,\"\u00a0Mr Petersen said.", "\"We were able to use the local community and businesses to do that repair work on the airfield to make it safe for the Royal Flying Doctor to come out and do those vaccinations.\"", "
'A lot of convincing'
", "The vaccine uptake in the township of less than 100 people was in contrast to challenges faced in other small Aboriginal communities.", "On the APY Lands in South Australia's far north-west, health authorities have been fighting an increasingly difficult battle against online misinformation and vaccine hesitancy.", "Philippa Johnson, a ranger from Nepabunna working in the Nantawarrina Indigenous Protected Area, said she had been reluctant to be vaccinated.", "\"I was scared of hearing everything about blood clots, and how it was going to affect me in the long run.\"", "Ms Johnson said she felt \"a lot healthier\" now she was vaccinated.", "", "
Many Aboriginal communities are finding it difficult to reach high vaccination rates, but not Nepabunna.(Supplied: Carmen Brown)
", "Local Landcare coordinator Denise Wilton said there was a strong desire in the community to avoid another harsh lockdown like the one many South Australian Indigenous towns faced in 2020.", "\"I think that was a bit hard on the community, so they all decided to get the vaccination and to make it easier for themselves the next time,\" Ms Wilton said.", "The double vaccination rate in South Australia is about 74 per cent.", "", "
WA's COVID-19 reopening roadmap
"]
